verses.text: For we know that if our earthly house of \add this\add* tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, a house not made with hand, eternal in the heavens.
For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:
if so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.
For we that are in \add this\add* tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.
Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame \add thing is\add* God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.
Therefore \add we are\add* always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:
(for we walk by faith, not by sight:)
we are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.
Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.

For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the \add things done\add* in \add his\add* body, according to that he hath done, whether \add it be\add* good or bad.
Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.
For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that you may have \add somewhat\add* to \add answer\add* them which glory in appearance, and not in heart.
For whether we be besides ourselves, \add it is\add* to God: or whether we be sober, \add it is\add* for your cause.
For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:
and \add that\add* he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose \add again\add*.
Wherefore henceforth know we no \add man\add* after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we \add him\add* no more.
Therefore if any \add man be\add* in Christ, \add he is\add* a new creature: old \add things\add* are past away; behold, all \add things\add* are become new.
And all \add things are\add* of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;
to wit, that God was in Christ reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.
\add Now\add* then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech \add you\add* by us: we pray \add you\add* in Christâ€™s stead, be ye reconciled to God.
For he hath made him \add to be\add* sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.
